intro: Telinaria acanthoclada, commonly known as the prickly telinaria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its spiny stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in the axils of the leaves. Its fruit is a small, round, and fleshy berry that contains several seeds. This plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
